page.title: 14ARTS AND CRAFTS IN BRILL.
page.content: Delia Whitlock is one of the few lacemakers left in this area.The lace made in Buckinghamshire is called Bucks Point.Lace schools used to exist in nearby Chilton and Long Crendon about 80 years ago for orphans.The fashion for lace died out in Queen Victoria's reign.Tony Roberts is one of the people in Brill who makes pottery.He gets his clay from the common and Stoke Pottery Centre.He has made pottery for nearly 20 years.In clay making you use tools such as wooden tools for shaping and cheese wire for cutting.Pottery has been made in Brill for 600 years or more.Bricks have been made for 300 years.The last bricks were made in 1919 near Norcotts Kiln,by the Hubbocks family.Patchwork has been done in Brill for many years.Mrs.Benenson is a wood carver and sculptor.She uses local wood such as yew,beech and elm.
